text: , also called Hokusai, was a Japanese artist. He was a master of the ukiyo-e style of woodblock prints and painting.Nussbaum, Louis Frédéric. (2005). "Hokusai" in Japan Encyclopedia, p. 345. The artist is best known for The Great Wave off Kanagawa, which is a woodblock print.Kleiner, Fred S. and Christin J. Mamiya, (2009). Gardner's Art Through the Ages: Non-Western Perspectives, p. 115. ==List of print series== * 53 Stations of the Tokaido Road, 1806 * 36 Views of Mount Fuji, 1823–1829 * The Dream of the Fisherman's Wife, 1820 * A Tour of the Waterfalls of the Provinces, 1827–1830 * Unusual Views of Celebrated Bridges in the Provinces, 1827-1830 * 100 Views of Mount Fuji, 1834 ==References== ==Other websites== * Artencyclopedia.com, Hokusai Category:Japanese printmakers Category:1760 births Category:1849 deaths Category:Artists from Tokyo
title: Katsushika Hokusai
